Are you feeling sick? 
Make sure to contact a docter
symptoms: If you have any COVID-19 related symptoms,
local_practitioner: please call your local general practitioner for advice.
going_trip:
Are you going on a trip?
Are you coming back to Belgium?
phpl: Please fill out the Public Health Passenger Locator Form 48 hours before your arrival in Belgium!
name: Name
wearing_mask_protects: Wearing a face mask protects you and others from the spread of the coronavirus. It is one of the healthy reflexes that protects us all from the virus. You use a face mask to cover your nose and mouth. When you sneeze, cough or talk, droplets fly around. The face mask blocks the droplets. That way, there is less risk of making someone sick. In other words, wearing a face mask is primarily about protecting others.
washing_your_hands: Washing your hands is the best way to stop germs from spreading. Think about all of the things that you touched today — from the telephone to the toilet. Maybe you blew your nose in a tissue and then went outside to dig around the dirt. Whatever you did today, you came into contact with germs. It's easy for a germ on your hand to end up in your mouth. Think about how many foods you eat with your hands. You can't wear rubber gloves all day long, but you can wash your hands so those germs don't get a chance to make you or someone else sick.
physical_distancing: Social distancing, also called “physical distancing”, means keeping a safe space between yourself and other people who are not from your household. To practice social or physical distancing, stay at least 6 feet (about 2 arms' length) from other people who are not from your household in both indoor and outdoor spaces.
dont_touch: Don't touch your nose, eyes and mouth!
prevent_infections: To help prevent infections, keep your hands away from your eyes, nose, and mouth. Why? Touching the mucous membranes on your face with your dirty hands allows germs that cause respiratory infections to enter the body.
stay_home: Stay at home when you feel sick!
most_sick: Most people with COVID-19 have mild illness and can recover at home without medical care. Do not leave your home, except to get medical care. Do not visit public areas.
sneeze_cough: Sneeze and cough into your elbow
sneezing: When sneezing all your body fluids spatter around in a one-mile radius. Do not visit public areas.
contacting_doctor: Contact your general practitioner if you develop a fever, cough, and difficult breathing.
pasop_oudemensen_infectie: Pay extra attention to people who are sensitive to the virus!
pasop_oudemensen: Pay extra attention to people who are sensitive to the virus: people over 65 years of age, people with diabetes (type 2), in combination with obesity and / or problems with heart, lungs or kidneys, people with problems with heart, lungs or kidneys and people prone to infections.
